str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From euthumos; to cheer up, i.e. be cheerful; neuter comparative more cheerfully.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
